page.title: 04WATER EATON MANOR
page.content: Water Eaton Manor was built in 1586 by Sir Edward Frere. At the turn of the century it was partly restored by G.F.Bodley, a descendant of Sir Thomas Bodley who built the Bodleian Library.At the front of the garden at each corner there are two guest houses built in 1661.Guests of the Manor used to sleep there and at one time King Charles 1 stayed in one of them.They are each three storeys high. Now Mr. and Mrs. Sawyer and their two children live in the Manor which has lots of lovely Jacobean oak panelling.
